name: unrepresentativeness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not being typical of a larger group of people or things: There is clear evidence of unrepresentativeness in the sample. Polls have many flaws as measures of public opinion, such as the risk of unrepresentativeness. Related word
unrepresentative
More examplesFewer examplesTo a large extent, this unrepresentativeness reflects some of the structural inequalities of contemporary society.It is tempting to ask whether this unrepresentativeness really matters.The group chosen for the study may be atypical leading to unrepresentativeness.
